description.narrative: Output 1.5. By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to sustainably increase access to and use of quality/safe drinking water, improved sanitation and positive hygiene practices in rural and poor urban households and communities, as well as institutions, in both development and humanitarian situations, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1.By 2025, new-borns, children and adolescent boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations, have increased access to and use of quality integrated health, nutrition, HIV and early stimulation services and benefit from a more nurturing, protective and clean environment

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Education and training in water supply and sanitation
Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Uganda Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5. By 2025, the Government and stakeholders at national and subnational level will have increased capacity to sustainably increase access to and use of quality/safe drinking water, improved sanitation and positive hygiene practices in rural and poor urban households and communities, as well as institutions, in both development and humanitarian situations
